metadata.title: RA Family: RFP could fail in verification when programming new image depending on the AWS.BTFLG (Startup Area Select Flag) setting

sections.content:
Question:
RFP could fail in verification when programming new image depending on the AWS.BTFLG (Startup Area Select Flag) setting
Answer:
When you use RFP to program a new image to an MCU with a different AWS.BTFLG setting from the setting that has been programmed in the MCU, the MCU will immediately swap BLOCK0 area and BLOCK1 area during the flash programming. That results in a verification error on RFP because different memory area is read from the MCU during the memory verification. If you want to change the AWS.BTFLG setting in a new program image, it is advised to write the value to AWS register first in the option setting memory, and then write a new program.
Suitable Products
RA and FSP
